intro: Jussiaea tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled willow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, willow-like stems and small, four-angled leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or wetland environments. Jussiaea tetragona is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
